1611.verse: فَلَمَّا|So when|77|87|141$ذَهَبُواْ بِهِۦ|they took him|115|135|8854$وَأَجْمَعُوٓاْ|and agreed|105|125|8855$أَن|that|48|68|655$يَجْعَلُوهُ|they put him|104|124|8856$فِى|in|48|68|89$غَيَـٰبَتِ|(the) bottom|106|116|8835$ٱلْجُبِّ‌ۚ|(of) the well.|107|118|8836$وَأَوْحَيْنَآ|But We inspired|123|144|4642$إِلَيْهِ|to him,|66|87|296$لَتُنَبِّئَنَّهُم|"Surely, you will inform them|208|229|8857$بِأَمْرِهِمْ هَـٰذَا|about this affair,|137|148|8858$وَهُمْ|while they|88|190|256$لَا|(do) not|75|278|30$يَشْعُرُونَ|perceive."|105|207|88$

1612.verse: وَجَآءُوٓ|And they came|120|160|6690$أَبَاهُمْ|(to) their father|126|206|8859$عِشَآءً|early at night|109|189|8860$يَبْكُونَ|weeping.|80|120|8861$

1614.verse: وَجَآءُو|And they brought|136|153|6690$عَلَىٰ|upon|63|97|52$قَمِيصِهِۦ|his shirt|101|135|8868$بِدَمٍ كَذِبٍ‌ۚ|with false blood.|129|163|8869$قَالَ|He said,|73|107|309$بَلْ|"Nay,|55|72|848$سَوَّلَتْ لَكُمْ|has enticed you|126|137|8870$أَنفُسُكُمْ|your souls|87|109|8871$أَمْرًا‌ۖ|(to) a matter,|113|135|1085$فَصَبْرٌ|so patience|97|119|8872$جَمِيلٌ‌ۖ|(is) beautiful.|109|131|8873$وَٱللَّهُ|And Allah|81|92|167$ٱلْمُسْتَعَانُ|(is) the One sought for help|205|244|8874$عَلَىٰ|against|68|146|52$مَا|what|53|131|262$تَصِفُونَ|you describe."|114|153|8875$

1615.verse: وَجَآءَتْ|And there came|125|141|8876$سَيَّارَةٌ|a caravan|86|117|8877$فَأَرْسَلُواْ|and they sent|113|144|8878$وَارِدَهُمْ|their water drawer|143|174|8879$فَأَدْلَىٰ|then he let down|133|149|8880$دَلْوَهُۥ‌ۖ|his bucket.|93|109|8881$قَالَ|He said,|73|105|309$يَـٰبُشْرَىٰ|"O good news!|116|148|8882$هَـٰذَا|This|59|91|248$غُلَـٰمٌ‌ۚ|(is) a boy."|94|126|2834$وَأَسَرُّوهُ|And they hid him|131|147|8883$بِضَـٰعَةً‌ۚ|(as) a merchandise.|152|172|8884$وَٱللَّهُ|And Allah|81|120|167$عَلِيمُۢ|(is) All- Knower|122|161|307$بِمَا|of what|71|110|43$يَعْمَلُونَ|they do.|92|112|912$

1616.verse: وَشَرَوْهُ|And they sold him|138|151|8885$بِثَمَنِۭ|for a price|88|114|8886$بَخْسٍ|very low,|81|107|8887$دَرَٲهِمَ|dirhams|79|105|8888$مَعْدُودَةٍ|few,|91|117|8378$وَكَانُواْ|and they were|116|129|615$فِيهِ|about him|85|178|32$مِنَ|of|50|235|156$ٱلزَّٲهِدِينَ|those keen to give up.|170|262|8889$

1617.verse: وَقَالَ|And said|76|83|1089$ٱلَّذِى|the one who|103|117|138$ٱشْتَرَٮٰهُ|bought him|93|107|976$مِن|of|50|64|53$مِّصْرَ|Egypt|76|90|8890$لِٱمْرَأَتِهِۦٓ|to his wife,|102|116|8891$أَكْرِمِى|"Make comfortable|142|149|8892$مَثْوَٮٰهُ|his stay.|77|87|8893$عَسَىٰٓ|Perhaps|73|93|4255$أَن|that|48|68|655$يَنفَعَنَآ|(he) will benefit us|144|164|8894$أَوْ|or|41|61|154$نَتَّخِذَهُۥ|we will take him|125|145|8895$وَلَدًا‌ۚ|(as) a son."|98|108|1079$وَكَذَٲلِكَ|And thus|91|101|1273$مَكَّنَّا|We established|120|140|8896$لِيُوسُفَ|Yusuf|91|111|8897$فِى|in|48|68|89$ٱلْأَرْضِ|the land|92|112|100$وَلِنُعَلِّمَهُۥ|that We might teach him|185|195|8898$مِن تَأْوِيلِ|(the) interpretation of|167|176|8899$ٱلْأَحَادِيثِ‌ۚ|the events.|107|125|8813$وَٱللَّهُ|And Allah|81|99|167$غَالِبٌ|(is) Predominant|128|146|8900$عَلَىٰٓ|over|63|81|52$أَمْرِهِۦ|His affairs,|90|99|5256$وَلَـٰكِنَّ|but|78|109|952$أَكْثَرَ|most|64|126|2155$ٱلنَّاسِ|(of) the people|120|182|75$لَا|(do) not|75|136|30$يَعْلَمُونَ|know.|92|123|115$

1618.verse: وَلَمَّا|And when|85|100|852$بَلَغَ|he reached|94|123|5476$أَشُدَّهُۥٓ|his maturity,|103|132|6180$ءَاتَيْنَـٰهُ|We gave him|105|134|6995$حُكْمًا|wisdom|70|99|5035$وَعِلْمًا‌ۚ|and knowledge.|123|138|8901$وَكَذَٲلِكَ|And thus|91|182|1273$نَجْزِى|We reward|91|274|5793$ٱلْمُحْسِنِينَ|the good-doers.|127|218|556$

1611.verse: So when they took him [out] and agreed to put him into the bottom of the well... But We inspired to him, "You will surely inform them [someday] about this affair of theirs while they do not perceive [your identity]."

1612.verse: And they came to their father at night, weeping.

1613.verse: They said, "O our father, indeed we went racing each other and left Joseph with our possessions, and a wolf ate him. But you would not believe us, even if we were truthful."

1614.verse: And they brought upon his shirt false blood. [Jacob] said, "Rather, your souls have enticed you to something, so patience is most fitting. And Allah is the one sought for help against that which you describe."

1615.verse: And there came a company of travelers; then they sent their water drawer, and he let down his bucket. He said, "Good news! Here is a boy." And they concealed him, [taking him] as merchandise; and Allah was knowing of what they did.

1616.verse: And they sold him for a reduced price - a few dirhams - and they were, concerning him, of those content with little.

1617.verse: And the one from Egypt who bought him said to his wife, "Make his residence comfortable. Perhaps he will benefit us, or we will adopt him as a son." And thus, We established Joseph in the land that We might teach him the interpretation of events. And Allah is predominant over His affair, but most of the people do not know.

1618.verse: And when Joseph reached maturity, We gave him judgment and knowledge. And thus We reward the doers of good.
